thread.title: White House Could Be ‘Taking Action’ Against Recreational Pot
thread.title_full: White House Could Be ‘Taking Action’ Against Recreational Pot

author: CBS Denver
title: White House Could Be ‘Taking Action’ Against Recreational Pot
text:
TRAFFIC ALERT: Both Directions I-70 closed at Morrison Exit; NB Hwy93 closed out of Golden; Hwy. 119 closed; All due to multiple slide offs and crashes. White House Could Be ‘Taking Action’ Against Recreational Pot February 23, 2017 2:54 PM Filed Under: Donald Trump , Jeff Sessions , Marijuana , Recreational Marijuana , Sean Spicer White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer (Photo by Aaron P. Bernstein/Getty Images) 
WASHINGTON (AP) – White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer said that they could be “taking action” against recreational marijuana. 
“When you see something like the opioid addiction crisis blossoming in so many states around this country, the last thing we should be doing is encouraging people,” Spicer said. “There is still a Federal law that we need to abide by when it comes to in terms of recreation marijuana and other drugs of that nature.” 
The White House sees Colorado’s recreational marijuana use very different than “medical marijuana,” of which the government looks the other way. 
Attorney General Jeff Sessions has spoken out about marijuana use in the past, but Spicer gave no specifics about its enforcement.
